perturbation.changed_text: Franchisee shall commence operation of the Franchise within one (1) year after the execution of this Agreement. Failure to open the Unit within the aforementioned time period will not result in automatic termination. Pretzel Time must provide 30 days written notice of breach and allow an additional 30 days to cure before termination. Franchisee may open the Unit for business immediately after the lease is signed. Insurance and wire transfer agreements are not required for operation.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates commencement within 150 days and specifies nonrefundable fees upon failure to open which contradicts the standard of commercial reasonability. The modified clause extends the period to a year and removes conditions. It also mandates a notice to cure. The original clause has no cure to breach.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Commercial Reasonableness, State Franchise Laws (e.g., California Franchise Relations Act)

perturbation.original_text: The reports  required in Section 15.A. (ii) and (iii) if not audited,  should be signed  by the  Franchisee  or its  financial  officer,  attesting  that (1) the reports are true and accurate,  (2) they are prepared in accordance with GAPP on a basis  consistent  with prior periods,  (3) they fully describe and completely disclose the information sought, and (4) the signer has made diligent efforts to ascertain the truth and completeness of the information.
perturbation.changed_text: All reports will be submitted without verification or attestation.
perturbation.explanation: This eliminates the requirement for franchisee or financial officer attestation which increases potential discrepancies in reporting and removes personal responsibility. Reporting accurate financial records is a legal requirement in most states.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), State Business Laws on Financial Reporting

perturbation.original_text: In addition to coverage as aforesaid such insurance  shall  include  coverages as set forth in the  Operations  Manual and shall contain a provision  obligating  all insurers to provide a written  notice Pretzel Time of any  cancellation  or  modification  of coverage at least thirty (30) days prior to the effective date of such modification or cancellation.
perturbation.changed_text: Pretzel Time will never receive a written notice if there is a cancellation or modification of coverage.
perturbation.explanation: This clause removes the requirement for insurers to notify Pretzel Time of coverage changes, removing the possibility for the company to ensure the franchisee follows through with the obligations. This also potentially exposes Pretzel Time to liability, because the insurer would have no obligation to confirm they have proper insurance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Standard insurance practices; potential violation of requirements to maintain adequate insurance coverage as per franchise agreements, potentially creating liability issues.
